Reviews.Title: “Very cute and comfortable hotel in downtown Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: NoSoyDeAquiNiSoyDeA
Reviews.Content: I did not know of this hotel. It has an awesome terrace where to hang out if weather is nice. The hotel seems to be very old and well kept but the interiors are modern and chic. Interesting combination. Service at the bar was awfully slow but that was not what makes me want a hotel anyway. Location is great to scout around downtown or to leave to the airport early the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully restored hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: mattanddan
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a two night trip to Mexico city where colleagues and I stayed in this hotel. The hotel is in a beautifully restored building looking onto a central courtyard. Probably would have given this 5 stars had it not been for noise and a few issues with breakfast. We all stayed in the deluxe rooms on the 2nd floor. Positives - Beautifully restored building and rooms - Very comfortable beds; rooms also have ironing boards, safes, free wireless (ask reception for password), big flat screen TV with a large selection of channels - Best shower I've had in a hotel - rainforest shower with great water pressure and a skylight two floors up - Incredibly friendly and helpful staff - especially the bell boys - Great location - easy walk to Revolution Monument, to the historic district and the main city square - Rooms very clean Negatives - When the roof top bar is open (it was on Valentines Day), fairly loud music is played in the courtyard which carries clearly into the rooms - although it didn't go on too late - Breakfast on the first day took over an hour and not all items were delivered, although they still tried to charge for them - On second day, although breakfast was meant to start at 7am, by 7.20 it still wasn't open, so we had to go to Starbucks across the park

Reviews.Title: “Travelling across the time in the Boutique Hotel de Cortés”
Reviews.Author: michelangelof
Reviews.Content: Walking down the "Alameda Central", we stopped in front of this facility. We read something related to the conqueror Cortes. It was the curiosity or something else, but eventually we decided to visit this place. Suddenly, the city´s noise disappeared, and we get involved in the strong quietly of the silence, which was broken time to time by the whistle of the birds in their cage. We asked the sales person to get into the rooms, it was incredible, more than four centuries had passed on. Now I am travelling in other Mexico´s regions, when I came down to Mexico´s city I will be visiting "Hotel de Cortés" again.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, but next time I will stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Ranchessa
Reviews.Content: Great location ...but next time I will stay elsewhere. Too many small annoyances, messages not received, breakfast supposed to be included was charged, staff pleasant but not too helpful, or knowledgable. Coffee is provided in the room when you first arrive, but is not replaced ... we stayed four days, and were told that we could have more if we checked out, and then checked in again! I am now looking for another small hotel as I love to visit Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but with some imperfections.”
Reviews.Author: Ranxer0x
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but I wouldn't defined it as a boutique hotel! the room was big, no door to separate the bathroom. The shower was huge, but all the water come out of it, and spread in the room. We were 2 but there was just one bathrobe. So it was a nice hotel, but with some imperfections. The building is very beautiful and old, but I would preferred to stay closer to the zocalo. Outside there was a fair or something like this with a rollercoast, maybe just for the xmas period, but anyway there was a lot of noise. We eat at the restaurant and the food was good. The breakfast is good as well, but at the end we discovered that for some food at the buffet there was an extra to paid! and there was no sing to inform you about it. The staff is very nice and kind, they help us with taxis and we lost a jaket at the airport and the call for us the flight company.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here before "boutique" and returned to stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Grayontheroad
Reviews.Content: The old Hotel de Cortes was one of my mainstays in Mexico City and, after a five year absence, we decided to return. Gone is the old well in the courtyard, the comfortable pigskin chairs, and the expanse of bougainvilla. Gone too is the cranky plumbing and dark rooms. On the whole, the renovation has been a good thing. Arriving late and without reservations, we were offered a suite at a reduced price--turned out to be the same room we first had years ago. Innovative lighting, spectacular shower, more-than-king-sized bed, IPod port in the stereo, free wifi, etc. were certainly welcome improvements. What remained is the same friendly service. They still have a few glitches to work out, and not everyone with think it is "boutique" but for those who want comfort in a 350+ year-old building, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice atmosphere and kind staff”
Reviews.Author: Ullapeppa
Reviews.Content: I moved to this hotel from the much bigger, fancier, business oriented Fiesta Americana Reforma looking for a cozier environment and a more personal attention. I was not disappointed. Despite the difficult start (at my arrival in the room neither phone or internet connection were working - which was promptly resolved by the hotel staff) I had a very nice stay in this old monastery. Only 2 things to be kept in consideration: internet connection is not very good in all spots (in my room I could connect with my computer but not with my IPhone, while I had no problem in the breakfast room) and in the weekends the club inside the hotel (rooftop) becomes very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience.”
Reviews.Author: TTTony
Reviews.Content: One of the most important aspects of any hotel is staff service. I was impressed by all staff members; and I do mean ALL. I was impressed also by the fact that they were not â€œtip hungryâ€�. But go ahead and tip them, they deserve it. They were always helpful and smiling even after I had as an experiment delayed tipping by a day. The exterior has the old architecture look but inside is quite modern with an angular theme. Sink, toilet bowl, knobs etc were square or rectangular. The floor was well done parquet. I stayed at room 108 from the 3rd. to the 7th. The room was of adequate but not luxurious size and I loved the comfortable bed. There were enough lights, controls and electrical outlets to suit any traveller and any mood. I liked the idea of the DVD player and radio in addition to the television. The lack of a bathtub did not bother me as I am only comfortable using mine at home. The floor of the bathroom was also made of wood. There were adequate toiletries and towels, a complimentary new pair of bedroom slippers, enough clothes racks, an iron and very clean and stainless ironing board. For some reason, I occasionally lost hot water during a shower. What I found quirky was the clear glass door to the toilet and shower. You have to be sharing the room with someone with whom you are very familiar to be comfortable with that feature. I wondered why smoked glass was not used. If you have rambunctious kids and teenagers you have to warn them. While the glass door to the bathroom swings inwards, the one to the adjoining toilet slides makes contact with masonry to fully close. With no damping material installed I think it can be broken if sufficient force is used to close the door. Apparently there have been no such incidents. Taxis are always available in about 10 minutes, but ensure that you get the hotel to have the taxi driver to commit to a price. In my experiences, the taxi driver always charged 25% more than the price indicated by the hotel. The hotel is near to restaurants, shopping areas and a park. The hotel has a variety of tasty meals, drinks and dessert on offer at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel that needs to work on its service”
Reviews.Author: Ca_Ap
Reviews.Content: On first impression, the hotel is fantastic. Great location, great building,lovely courtyard and our room was big, nicely decorated equipped with modern appliances(flat screen TV, ipod dock...). The bar on the roof is trendy and enjoyable early on Friday night only to become a nightclub later and for the weekend. The music is very loud and annoying. We also experienced music early in the morning which woke us up. The breakfast is good but the service was very slow and unattentive. The front desk is trying to be helpful but can give you wrong information at times. We asked twice for the reception to book an appoitment for Casa Barragan only to be told dismisively that this was not required. When we complained upon our return from Casa Barragan and after confirming that the appoitment was required the staff was not really apologetic. However they booked a private guide tour for us with a guide called Israel which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things about this charming small hotel”
Reviews.Author: thouzel
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter and I spent a week at the de Cortes and highly recommend it. The hotel is close to the main cathedral and Zocolo & right off of the Hidalgo subway stop. This very attractive 27 room, centrally located, newly refurbished boutique hotel has the most wonderful staff imaginable and apart from the noisy roof Disco Fridays and Saturdays it is sheer perfection. Very clean, friendly and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in a great location”
Reviews.Author: chris2401
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for 6 nights and had a great time. I was a bit worried about the mixed reviews in the beginning, but if you're looking for a stylish boutique hotel with character, the hotel is perfect. It's right in the historical district and offers easy access to all the interesting sights. We booked a Junior suite, which was nicely appointed with the largest shower I've ever experienced. The room was next to a busy street, but you could only hear the common city noises that you'll here in any big city. We had dinner and breakfast in the restaurant and the food was consistently good. The only thing we didn't like was that you had to ask the service staff for the breakfast menu each morning and it wasn't really explained what was included. The hotel booked for us a private city tour with a guy called Jorge Mendoza which was fantastic and I would very much recommend! It's a bit of a shame that the hotel doesn't have any fitness facilities or a pool but the rooftop bar is fun.

Reviews.Title: “A place to escape from the busy city”
Reviews.Author: Laberron
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Cortes for a weekend, and it has been so far the best place in Mexico DF. A hidden gem within a very busy city. Close access to the centre and most tourist attractions downtown. Rooms are spectacular, very big and comfortable beds, an amazing shower, good taste in the decoration, and fully equipped with stereo, tv, etc. A great terrace with a nice view of the surroundings. My first choice of hotel in Mexico, a bit expensive but totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful place...even modernized!”
Reviews.Author: stinson
Reviews.Content: I just spent 6 nights here and was very happy with the hotel. I have a 25 plus year relationship with this hotel, although I hadn't been here since the remodel. I was a little worried about the reviews that I read. It's still a magnificent colonial building, and no amount of modernization of rooms and furniture will change that...and the excellent new beds are definitely an improvement! It is very different than it was in the past when there was a courtyard fountain and birds and equipale furniture and painted flowers, birds and trim in the rooms, but it's just different, not bad. The staff is very professional, the service is excellent and friendly. Having read so many comments here about noise, I was surprised to find that noise was definitely not a problem. I mentioned this to one of the staff members who said they had been working on what some saw as a problem. It is a stone courtyard, and sound will echo, even if it's someone coming in late at night or leaving early in the morning. It's well worth a little bit of noise to stay in this magnificent building. I did not hear any loud thumping music noise during my entire stay which included a weekend. The food in the restaurant is excellent. If there is any improvement to be made...then I think a good addition to the menu would be small plates that could be ordered with before dinner drinks. The wireless internet worked well from my room or out in the courtyard. Given it's excellent location next to a metro stop and a major bus route, across the street from the Alameda, and just a few blocks from the Bellas Artes, the Franz Mayer Museum, and the Museo Nacional de Estampa this is a very good value and a convenient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, not everything is perfect but I would come back”
Reviews.Author: FerrisXL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, my room was big and modern although a little noisy because next to a busy street. Nice bathroom! The receptionists were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was fine, a minus point was that breakfast was not yet ready at 7AM (the official opening time) the 1st day when we had an early meeting. On the 2nd day, when we appeared later, but still within the breakfast hours, we were the only guests and the lady was busy cleaning up around us and we got the feeling that she did want to get us out of the breakfast room quickly to be able to continue...not very relaxed. But all in all, a fine, charming hotel at a central location, I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, with limitations”
Reviews.Author: BRCDenver
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recently remodeled. It is very clean and modern, but a bit stark. The breakfast is good and the service is fine. I have two complanits however. The first, as mentioned in other reviews, was the loud music from the rooftop bar. It is loud thumping techno music. It wasn't so loud that we couldn't sleep, but it made sitting in the courtyard and having a drink uncomfortable. We didn't even consider going up to the rooftop bar because it was so loud. The people going to the bar seemed to be young prosperous locals. The bar would have been a nice place to sit and have a drink, it has a nice view, but it was just too loud and the music was really really bad. The other complaint is the odd door to the bathroom. It is clear glass. Not frosted, no covering, just clear glass. If you want to watch your travelling companion sitting on the toilet, then this is the hotel for you. If that isn't your thing, then be warned. I wouldn't say that either the noise or the bathroom doors disqualify staying there. just be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Such a pity: so close and so far from perfection”
Reviews.Author: ulpio
Reviews.Content: The first impression you get arriving at the Hotel de Cortes is great: an old convent recently renovated that has been hosting travelers for the last 200 years; pretty close to Zocalo (20 minutes walk) and the city center. When you walk into the room itâ€™s even better: while all the windows give on the patio and so the light is a bit dim you have a rather amazing shower room illuminated naturally by a skylight. The bed is one of the most comfortable I have ever slept on and while the room was not huge it is nicely organized, with tasty dÃ©cor and all the electronic accessories you need (plasma flat screen, hi-fi with iPOD dock, etc.). Working not so well was the free wireless in the room which was down most of the times and you needed to go outside to check mails. Breakfast was also very good, although at times the service was a bit disorganized leading to some delays; excellent freshly squeezed natural juices, very tasty sweet breads and a nice choice of eggs was toppled on Sundays by a very rich breakfast-buffet. You might be wondering what is there not to love in Hotel de Cortes. Well unfortunately the loud music blasted out from the terrace lounge from Thursday to Saturday evening until 3 in the morning. The music was so loud we could hardly sleep on our first night thereâ€¦ the management was not particularly sympathetic to our complaints the next morning. Seeking an alternative solution to closing down the lounge the hotel acknowledged that there were only few rooms that were sheltered from the noise; my parents got one of those but we were not so lucky so we had to endure buying some earplugsâ€¦not exactly what you dream of for your holidays. I would have happily considered the Cortes as one of my best stays if it wasnâ€™t for the musicâ€¦ the management in Cortes really needs to make up their mind on whether they want to run a hotel or a disco bar!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ecceUk
Reviews.Content: Wonderful atmosphere, warm and friendly staff and great location. Building has a beautiful design. An oasis within the centre of Mexico City. Strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “mexico city gem”
Reviews.Author: MsHackenbacker
Reviews.Content: Newish hotel with still some teething problems. our room was stylish & well appointed ;, however the air conditioner , whilst installed was not working and other small issues you'd expect to be resolved shortly. Fantastic historical building,central location, and excellent staff with the bonus that most speak good english.

Reviews.Title: “New and completely revamped”
Reviews.Author: kirker
Reviews.Content: FYI, the Hotel de Cortes was completely renovated during the course of 2008, and rather than a one-star dump, it's now a seriously posh four-star boutique hotel, with interior design by some of Mexico's top decorators and furniture designers, and no longer run by Best Western. None of the previous reviews on here are really applicable. I've stayed at every major design-oriented hotel in DF, and the de Cortes tops all of them, even the vaunted Condesa and Habita. Although I only saw a couple of the Cortes's rooms, the ones I saw were nothing short of huge, particularly in contrast to the Condesa & Habita. The new decor is completely contemporary; you wouldn't even know the building was hundreds of years old if looking at it solely from the inside. FYI, the hotel's mostly but not entirely complete; a new top floor add-on with spa is, as of this writing, under construction. Its pool, restaurant and bar areas are now open, however. My sole complaint would be the location: it's next to Alameda Park in the oldest part of the city. That's great if you're wanting to visit the multiple museums in and near the park, but the nightlife of Condesa and the Zona Rosa are quite a hike from there.
